intro: Allophylus apiocarpus, commonly known as the red-berried holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of red berries that persist through the winter. Its botanical features include a dioecious flowering system, where male and female flowers are found on separate plants. Allophylus apiocarpus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and seasonal fruiting.
